item.description: Fatal Traffic Collision; INC#1669; 09:36PM; 6830 W Manchester Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3F0khhc; Westchester; Firefighters found two patients deceased inside of a vehicle, which collided the median. Crews will remain on scene to extricate the victims, in coordination with LAPD (Inc 3916) and Coroner. Nothing further.; FS 5; Batt 4; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC4 E263 E5 E51 E95 EM13 HR3 RA63 RA95 T63 UR88; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1634; 09:31PM; 549 W 104th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3GRGezG; Vermont Vista; After rescuing one patient from inside the burning structure, firefighters navigated through excessive storage conditions inside of the one-story home to locate, confine, and extinguish the flames (31 FF in 21 min). The patient was transported in moderate condition. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 64; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E233 E264 E266 E57 E65 E66 EM13 RA33 RA64 RA65 RA864 T33 T64 T66; CH7; 12; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1634; 09:10PM; 549 W 104th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3GRGezG; Vermont Vista; One story single-family home with heavy smoke showing. Firefighters have rescued one person from inside the structure, containing excessive storage. Continuing in offensive mode.; FS 64; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E233 E264 E266 E57 E65 E66 EM13 RA33 RA64 RA65 RA864 T33 T64 T66; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

Train vs Pedestrian; INC#1545; 07:51PM; 660 S Figueroa St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3E4u2JO; Downtown; LAFD found one patient trapped under the train. Firefighters extricated one patient and transported them in grave condition to an area hospital. Firefighters continue to search for additional patients under the train.; FS 3; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC13 E203 E210 E211 E3 EM1 HR3 RA15 RA17 T10 T3; CH7; 12 15; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0521; 09:47AM; 255 S Loma Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3GLPAwP; Westlake; Firefighters located fire in one unit on the top floor (third occupied floor over one parking level) of a modern apartment building, where it appeared fire originated from a malfunctioning A/C unit, producing an abundance of smoke. It took 42 firefighters just 16 minutes to access, confine and extinguish the fire, which only partially damaged one unit. No reported injuries.; FS 11; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC11 BC13 BC5 CM22 E11 E20 E203 E211 E220 E227 E26 E3 E88 E9 EM5 HR3 RA11 RA3 RA811 SQ21 T11 T20 T27 T3 T9 UR27 UR88; CH7; 12 13 14; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0521; 09:31AM; 255 S Loma Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3GLPAwP; Westlake; Four-story modern apartment building with smoke showing. Offensive mode.; FS 11; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC11 BC13 BC5 CM22 E11 E20 E203 E211 E220 E227 E26 E3 E88 E9 EM5 HR3 RA11 RA3 RA811 SQ21 T11 T20 T27 T3 T9 UR27 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0214; 05:19AM; 216 N Mariposa Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3yvcqWq; Koreatown; *Corrected Address* It took 33 firefighters 26 minutes to access, confine and extinguish the flames in a 1,415 sq-ft one-story single-family home built in 1917. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 52; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 BC5 E11 E13 E211 E220 E229 E29 E52 EM11 RA6 T11 T20 T29; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

Update River Rescue; INC#0282; 10:00AM; 2658 E Washington Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3dQ8TIR; Downtown; Now a total of 3 vehicles have been swept down the LA River toward the Washington Bridge. The second vehicle has become "stacked" atop the first submerged vehicle (water level has risen). A third vehicle was carried past the bridge at Washington Blvd and proceeded into LA County FD jurisdiction. So far, no victims (if there are any) have been located or identified. The circumstances surrounding these three separate vehicles and their journey down the LA River remain unclear.; FS 17; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; AO1 AO2 BC1 BC11 CM20 CM22 E1 E14 E17 E201 E203 E221 E9 E90 EM1 H1 H2 HA1 HA2 HR3 PI1 RA1 RA14 RA17 SC1 SW44 SW88 T1 T21 T3 T9 UR3 UR88; CH7; 12 13 14; Nicholas Prange

River Rescue; INC#0451; 07:50AM; 12933 N Dronfield Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3IRurTw; Sylmar; Dispatchers received a 9-1-1 call from someone who was in a drainage channel/wash near Sylmar High School. The 26-year-old male victim was swept into a covered channel of the LA River, but was able to maintain his cellphone call to communicate with dispatchers. An engine on the street above continued to honk, as firefighters removed maintenance hole covers in the street. The victim reported by phone when he could hear the honk nearby, and firefighters effected the rescue through that maintenance hole. The patient is in fair condition and being evaluated by firefighter-paramedics for minor trauma and mild hypothermia.; FS 91; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 AO2 BC12 E298 E7 E91 E98 EM12 HR3 RA98 SC1 SW44 SW88 T98 UR88; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange
